item.title: Foxconn pushes into electric vehicle production near its biggest iPhone plant amid slow smartphone sales
item.description:
English Summary:

  • Foxconn Technology Group has established a new car venture in Zhengzhou, China, focusing on the electric vehicle (EV) industry.
  • The new firm, Foxconn New Energy Automobile Industry Development (Henan) Co, aims to manufacture and develop car components, motors, and sell NEVs.
  • Foxconn's move into the EV sector comes amid declining smartphone sales and a weakening global economy.
  • The company plans to build new factories in Henan province and has invested in a plant in India to produce Apple products.
  • Foxconn's Zhengzhou facility faced worker protests and an exodus of employees in 2022, impacting Apple's revenue.

中文总结：

  • 富士康科技集团在中国郑州成立了一家新的汽车合资企业，专注于电动汽车（EV）行业。
  • 新公司富士康新能源汽车产业发展（河南）有限公司，旨在制造和开发汽车零部件、电机并销售新能源汽车。
  • 富士康进军电动汽车领域之际，正值智能手机销量下降和全球经济疲软之际。
  • 该公司计划在河南省建设新工厂，并已在印度投资了一家工厂来生产苹果产品。
  • 富士康的郑州工厂在 2022 年面临工人抗议和大量员工流失，从而影响了苹果的收入。

单词：

  • venture (n.) - /ˈvɛntʃər/ 风险，冒险事业。

    原文例句：The new project will involve car component manufacturing and development, motor production and car sales.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语ventura （未来发生），表示“冒险，冒险事业”。在这个例句中，它指的是富士康科技集团在中国郑州成立了一家新的汽车合资企业。

  • revenue (n.) - /ˈrɛvənuː/ 收入，收益。

    原文例句：Foxconn reported US$198.9 billion in preliminary revenue for 2023, down 7 per cent from 2022.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语revenire （回来），表示“收入，收益，利息”。在这个例句中，它指的是富士康科技集团2023年收入下降7%。

  • exodus (n.) - /ˈɛksədəs/ 大量外流，大规模迁移。

    原文例句：In 2022, that facility was rocked by violent workers’ protests and an exodus of tens of thousands of employees that Apple CEO Tim Cook later blamed for a decline in the US company’s quarterly revenue.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于希腊语exodos（出口），表示“大量外流，大规模迁移”。在这个例句中，它指的是2022年富士康郑州工厂出现工人抗议和大量员工流失的情况。

词组：

  • step up - 加强，加大。

    原文例句：The new project will involve car component manufacturing and development, motor production and car sales.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由step（步）和up（向上）构成的，表示“加强，加大，提高”。在这个例句中，它表示富士康科技集团将加强汽车零部件制造和开发、电机生产和汽车销售。

句子：

  • Foxconn’s move into the EV sector comes amid declining smartphone sales and a weakening global economy. - 富士康进军电动汽车领域之际，正值智能手机销量下降和全球经济疲软之际。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Foxconn’s move into the EV sector comes，其中主语是Foxconn’s move into the EV sector，谓语是comes。amid declining smartphone sales and a weakening global economy是一个介词短语作状语，修饰comes，表示富士康进军电动汽车领域之际，正值智能手机销量下降和全球经济疲软之际。这个句子的意思是说，富士康进军电动汽车领域之际，正值智能手机销量下降和全球经济疲软之际。

语法：

  • 现在进行时 - 表示正在进行的动作或状态。

    原文例句：The new firm, named Foxconn New Energy Automobile Industry Development (Henan) Co, was established on January 4 with a registered capital of 500 million yuan (US$70 million), according to public records in the National Enterprise Credit Information Publicity System.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：be + 现在分词。其中be要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态正在进行，强调动作或状态的进行性和延续性。在这个例句中，be用的是was，表示过去时态，主语是The new firm，谓语是established，表示富士康新能源汽车产业发展（河南）有限公司于 1 月 4 日成立。

  • 祈使句 - 表示命令、请求或建议。

    原文例句：Separately, Foxconn plans to invest at least US$2.6 billion in a plant it is building in India to make Apple products, according to a report by Bloomberg last month.

    语法讲解：这是一种句型，结构是：动词原形 + 其他。其中动词原形根据主语的人称和数进行变化，其他部分根据句子的意思决定。这种句型表示命令、请求或建议。在这个例句中，动词原形是plans，主语是Foxconn，宾语是to invest at least US$2.6 billion in a plant it is building in India to make Apple products，表示富士康计划在印度投资至少 26 亿美元建设一家工厂来生产苹果产品。

  • The Apple supplier has set up a new venture in Zhengzhou to sharpen its focus on the electric vehicle industry
  • The new project will involve car component manufacturing and development, motor production and car sales

Foxconn Technology Group has set up a new car venture in Zhengzhou city, capital of central China’s Henan province and home to the world’s largest iPhone factory, as the Apple supplier steps up its efforts in the new energy vehicle (NEV) sector amid declining smartphone sales.

The new firm, named Foxconn New Energy Automobile Industry Development (Henan) Co, was established on January 4 with a registered capital of 500 million yuan (US$70 million), according to public records in the National Enterprise Credit Information Publicity System.

Its business covers car component manufacturing and development, motor production and NEV sales, among other areas.

Foxconn, known formally as Hon Hai Precision Industry, said the new venture belongs to Foxconn Innovation Industry Development Group Co and aims to sharpen the company’s focus on the electric vehicle industry, according to a report by the Securities Times on Tuesday.

Foxconn confirmed the report, adding that the Henan subsidiary was disclosed in December 2023 to the Taiwan Stock Exchange.

The world’s largest contract electronics manufacturer is accelerating its move into the automobile industry amid weakening demand for smartphones and consumer gadgets.

The Taiwanese giant last week reported US$198.9 billion in preliminary revenue for 2023, down 7 per cent from 2022. It blamed slow market demand for its static consumer electronics product business in the fourth quarter, while expecting continuing decline in the first quarter of this year.

In October, Foxconn announced a new electric cargo van called Model N and announced plans to mass produce its compact SUV Model B. Jun Seki, its chief strategy officer for electric vehicles, said the company was in touch with about 14 potential customers and saw India and Japan as promising countries for EV development.

To help push the company towards its new direction, Foxconn opened a new global business base in Zhengzhou last April and reaffirmed its commitment to the Chinese market, even as the firm and other Apple suppliers move to diversify their supply chain.

Foxconn plans to start building new factories for smartphones and electronics goods in the cities of Zhoukou, Kaifeng and Jiyuan in Henan, according to a list of major construction projects in 2024 released last week by the provincial Development and Reform Commission.

The company, which was put under a tax and land use investigation in October by mainland authorities, employs 200,000 workers in its Zhengzhou manufacturing complex.

In 2022, that facility was rocked by violent workers’ protests and an exodus of tens of thousands of employees that Apple CEO Tim Cook later blamed for a decline in the US company’s quarterly revenue.

Separately, Foxconn plans to invest at least US$2.6 billion in a plant it is building in India to make Apple products, according to a report by Bloomberg last month.

item.title: CES 2024: China EV maker Xpeng accepts pre-orders for flying car but notes urban use is far off
item.description:
English Summary：

Xpeng unveils plans to launch its flying car, marking its entry into the urban air mobility market. The company showcased two types of flying vehicles at CES 2024, including an international debut of its new AeroHT eVTOL model. While aiming to deliver the first batch of flying cars by late 2025, Xpeng acknowledges the need for regulatory approvals and focuses on a consumer market where it can introduce the flying experience and gradually expand to urban transportation. CEO Brian Gu emphasized their distinction from EHang's products, targeting a broader consumer base and integrating vehicle and aircraft capabilities. The company is in discussions with Chinese regulators but recognizes that international expansion faces geopolitical challenges, exemplified by DJI's inclusion on the US Entity List.
  • Abstract: Xpeng's entry into the flying car market with a focus on consumer experience and gradual regulatory integration.
  • Theme: Unveiling flying car models, discussing regulatory challenges, and targeting a consumer-focused market.
  • Viewpoint: Xpeng's strategy to introduce the flying experience to consumers while seeking regulatory approvals and addressing geopolitical tensions.
  • Main information: Showcase of flying car models at CES, pre-order and delivery plans, emphasis on consumer market, comparison with EHang's products, discussions with Chinese regulators, and consideration of global expansion challenges.

中文总结：

小鹏汽车正式发布旗下首款飞行汽车，宣告进军城市空中出行市场。该公司在 2024 年国际消费电子展 (CES) 上展示了两款飞行汽车，其中 AeroHT eVTOL 型号是国际首发。小鹏汽车计划在 2025 年第四季度交付第一批飞行汽车，但对监管部门的审批持观望态度，并专注于消费者市场，希望先让人们体验飞行再等待法规框架的完善，逐步实现城市交通服务。首席执行官顾宏地强调了他们与亿航产品的区别，瞄准更广泛的消费群体，并整合了汽车和飞行器的功能。该公司正在与中国监管机构进行谈判，但意识到国际扩张面临着地缘政治挑战，例如大疆被纳入美国实体清单就是一个例子。
  • 摘要：小鹏汽车进入飞行汽车市场，关注消费者体验和循序渐进的监管整合。
  • 主题：发布飞行汽车型号、探讨监管挑战、面向消费者的市场目标。
  • 观点：小鹏汽车的策略是在寻求监管批准和应对地缘政治紧张局势的同时，向消费者推出飞行体验。
  • 主要信息：在 CES 上展示飞行汽车型号、预订和交付计划、强调消费市场、与亿航产品对比、与中国监管机构讨论、考虑全球扩张挑战。

单词：

  • debut (n.) - /ˈdeɪbjuː/ 首次登场，首演。

    原文例句：Seven years after EHang debuted its first passenger drone, Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng entered the market with its own “flying car”.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于法语，表示“首次登场，首演”。在这个例句中，它指的是亿航在七年后推出了自己的第一款载人无人机，而中国电动汽车制造商小鹏汽车则带着自己的“飞行汽车”进入了市场。

  • modular (adj.) - /ˈmɒdjʊlə/ 模块化的，单元化的。

    原文例句：Its modular Land Aircraft Carrier will start taking pre-orders in the fourth quarter this year, with deliveries to start a year later.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，表示“模块化的，单元化的”。在这个例句中，它指的是小鹏汽车的模块化陆地航空母舰将在今年第四季度开始接受预订，并于一年后开始交付。

  • sportier (adj.) - /ˈspɔːtiə/ 更运动的，更具运动感的。

    原文例句：The sportier AeroHT eVTOL (electric vertical take-off and landing) car made its international debut at the show, having previously conducted flying tests in China.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于sport（运动），表示“更运动的，更具运动感的”。在这个例句中，它指的是更运动的 AeroHT eVTOL（电动垂直起降）汽车在展会上首次亮相，此前已在中国进行了飞行测试。

词组：

  • urban air mobility - 城市空中出行。

    原文例句：Xpeng unveils plans to launch its flying car, marking its entry into the urban air mobility market.

    例句讲解：这个词组由urban（城市）, air（空气）和mobility（出行）组成，表示“城市空中出行”。在这个例句中，它指的是小鹏汽车发布了推出飞行汽车的计划，标志着其进入城市空中出行市场。

  • international debut - 国际首发。

    原文例句：The sportier AeroHT eVTOL (electric vertical take-off and landing) car made its international debut at the show.

    例句讲解：这个词组由international（国际）和debut（首次登场）组成，表示“国际首发”。在这个例句中，它指的是更运动的 AeroHT eVTOL（电动垂直起降）汽车在展会上首次亮相。

句子：

  • The company’s subsidiary AeroHT presented two types of flying cars at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Tuesday. - 周二，该公司旗下的 AeroHT 在拉斯维加斯举行的 CES 2024 上展出了两种类型的飞行汽车。

    句子分析：这个句子是一个简单句，主语是 The company’s subsidiary AeroHT，谓语是 presented，宾语是 two types of flying cars。介词短语 at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Tuesday 表示时间和地点，修饰谓语 presented。这个句子的意思是说，周二，该公司旗下的 AeroHT 在拉斯维加斯举行的 CES 2024 上展出了两种类型的飞行汽车。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去的一个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Seven years after EHang debuted its first passenger drone, Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng entered the market with its own “flying car”.

    语法讲解：这个时态表示从过去的一个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。结构是：have/has + been + 过去分词。这个时态经常用于谈论过去开始到现在仍然持续的动作或状态。在这个例句中，它表示亿航在七年前推出了第一架载人无人机，而中国电动汽车制造商小鹏汽车则带着自己的“飞行汽车”进入了市场。

  • The company’s subsidiary AeroHT presented two types of flying cars at CES, including a sportier eVTOL that made its international debut
  • Xpeng president Brian Gu said the company is in talks with regulators in China to allow use of the vehicle, but international expansion ‘takes time’

Seven years after EHang debuted its first passenger drone, Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng entered the market with its own “flying car”, with the goal of delivering the first batch by the fourth quarter of 2025, whether regulations are ready or not.

The company’s subsidiary AeroHT presented two types of flying cars at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Tuesday. Its modular Land Aircraft Carrier will start taking pre-orders in the fourth quarter this year, with deliveries to start a year later. The sportier AeroHT eVTOL (electric vertical take-off and landing) car made its international debut at the show, having previously conducted flying tests in China.

There is no information on pricing or availability for the AeroHT, which has propellers that pop out of the back. It has been demoed for flying in China, but it did not take flight at CES. Brian Gu Hongdi, vice-chairman and president of Xpeng, suggested it could launch before regulations are in place for city use, but that people could eventually buy one and fly it in areas where the use of aircraft is not regulated.

Hisense and TCL push AI in TVs, chase industry trends like smart cars

“The design of our vehicles is not targeted for urban transportation … [which] requires an extensive regulatory approval process,” Gu said. “That’s why we’re targeting a consumer market, for people to first enjoy the experience of flying and then obviously with the regulatory framework in place, we gradually can move towards urban transportation.”

While Gu said it was too early to say what pricing might be, he expects it to be “similar to buying a luxury performance car”.

Similar products have been in the works for years. EHang made a splash when it debuted the EHang 184 at CES in 2016. In the years since, it has invited journalists to take rides and went public on the Nasdaq.

Xpeng distanced itself from the EHang comparison, saying its products are different and target different buyers. The EV company, which made its debut at CES two years after EHang with its first car, noted that EHang’s products are just aerial vehicles without the ability to be driven on roads. EHang is also targeting enterprise use, while Xpeng is targeting a wider consumer base.

“We are targeting the consumer market, which is very different,” Gu said. “I don’t see another company that’s doing that right now.”

While Xpeng has also highlighted how the Land Aircraft Carrier could be used for public services like emergency rescue, the new eVTOL car is a more stylish option that can conceal its rotors. This will presumably make it more appealing for people to buy, whenever it becomes available, even if they cannot fly it to work every morning.

AI to dominate CES 2024, with glasses for blind, shoes to walk faster

Gu said the company is already in talks with regulators in China but international expansion “takes time”.

Xpeng’s ambitions could face some challenges with current geopolitical tensions, though. Chinese drone tech has been caught in the cross hairs before. Washington put DJI, the world’s largest consumer drone maker, on its Entity List that bars US companies from doing business with it without express approval.

When asked whether this could present some hurdles, Gu said, “I’m not even thinking about that right now … This business is purely focused on the China market right now.”

item.title: TSMC halts revenue drop, beats expectations on brisk demand for AI chips from Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices
item.description:
Summary：

In the fourth quarter of 2023, TSMC, a major chip manufacturing company, reported revenues that matched earnings from the same period in the previous year, overcoming analyst expectations and its own projections. However, the overall revenue saw a decline of 4.5% to NT$2.16 trillion. Despite this, TSMC's high-performance computing business witnessed growth due to increasing demand for AI chips. The industry is anticipating a revival in 2024, with an uptick in chip sales observed in November 2023.
  • Abstract: TSMC's fourth-quarter revenue meets expectations, but annual revenue declines; AI demand aids recovery.
  • Theme: TSMC's financial performance and the impact of AI on the chip industry.
  • Viewpoint: TSMC's resilience and the role of AI in driving chip demand.
  • Main information: TSMC's revenue figures, decline in smartphone and laptop chip sales, growth in high-performance computing business, AI chip demand from Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices, and expectations for growth in 2024.

总结：

世界最大的芯片制造商台湾半导体制造公司 (TSMC) 公布其第四季度营收超过了分析师的预期，达到了去年同期的水平。尽管如此，全年营收仍下降了 4.5%，至 2.16 万亿新台币。尽管如此，TSMC 的高性能计算业务由于对人工智能芯片的需求不断增加而出现了增长。芯片行业预计将于 2024 年复苏，2023 年 11 月芯片销售额有所回升。
  • 摘要：TSMC第四季度营收超出预期，但全年营收下降；人工智能需求推动复苏。
  • 主题：TSMC的财务绩效以及人工智能对芯片行业的影响。
  • 观点：TSMC的韧性和人工智能在推动芯片需求中的作用。
  • 主要信息：TSMC的营收数据、智能手机和笔记本电脑芯片销售额下降、高性能计算业务增长、来自Nvidia和Advanced Micro Devices的人工智能芯片需求以及对2024年增长的预期。

单词：

  • revenue (n.) - /ˈrev.ə.nuː/ 收入，收益。

    原文例句：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC), the world's largest contract chip maker, saw its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline.

    例句讲解：revenue表示收入、收益，指公司或企业在一定时期内的营业收入总额。在这个例句中，TSMC第四季度的营收超过了分析师的预期。

  • decline (n.) - /dɪˈklaɪn/ 下降，衰退。

    原文例句：Overall revenue declined 4.5 per cent last year, to NT$2.16 trillion.

    例句讲解：decline表示下降、衰退，指经济或行业在一定时期内的萎缩或减弱。在这个例句中，TSMC去年全年的营收下降了4.5%，至2.16万亿新台币。

  • moderate (v.) - /ˈmɑːd.ər.eɪt/ 缓和，调节。

    原文例句：Over the course of 2023, TSMC moderated its capital expenditure plans as the consumer electronics industry grappled with a glut of unsold inventory.

    例句讲解：moderate表示缓和、调节，指使某物变得不那么激烈或严重。在这个例句中，TSMC在2023年期间缓和了其资本支出计划，因为消费电子行业正在努力应对大量未售出库存。

词组：

  • over the course of - 在……期间，在……过程中。

    原文例句：Over the course of 2023, TSMC moderated its capital expenditure plans as the consumer electronics industry grappled with a glut of unsold inventory.

    例句讲解：over the course of是短语动词，表示在……期间，在……过程中。在这个例句中，它表示在2023年期间，TSMC缓和了其资本支出计划。

  • high-performance computing - 高性能计算。

    原文例句：Top management including chief executive CC Wei have said they expect overall business to grow this year, and the company has seen its high-performance computing business boosted by demand for AI chips from Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices.

    例句讲解：high-performance computing表示高性能计算，指使用高性能计算机进行复杂的计算或处理大量数据的过程。在这个例句中，TSMC的高性能计算业务因来自Nvidia和Advanced Micro Devices对AI芯片的需求而得到提振。

句子：

  • TSMC, the world's largest contract chip maker, saw its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline, as demand from artificial intelligence (AI) players helped offset sluggish smartphone and laptop chip sales. - 全球最大的芯片代工商台积电公布其第四季度营收超出了预期，因为来自人工智能 (AI) 厂商的需求帮助抵消了智能手机和笔记本电脑芯片销售的疲软。

    句子分析：这是一个简单句，主句是TSMC saw its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline，其中主语是TSMC，谓语是saw，宾语是fourth-quarter revenue，定语是estimates of a decline。as demand from artificial intelligence (AI) players helped offset sluggish smartphone and laptop chip sales是一个从句，作原因状语，表示需求来自人工智能 (AI) 厂商帮助抵消了智能手机和笔记本电脑芯片销售的疲软。

语法：

  • 现在进行时 - 表示现在正在进行的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC), the world's largest contract chip maker, saw its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline, as demand from artificial intelligence (AI) players helped offset sluggish smartphone and laptop chip sales.

    语法讲解：现在进行时是一种时态，表示现在正在进行的动作或状态。其结构是：be + 动词的现在分词。在这个例句中，saw是be动词的过去式，beat是动词beat的现在分词，表示TSMC在第四季度达到了超过预期营收的状态。

  • 过去完成时 - 表示在过去某个时间之前已经完成的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Over the course of 2023, TSMC moderated its capital expenditure plans as the consumer electronics industry grappled with a glut of unsold inventory.

    语法讲解：过去完成时是一种时态，表示在过去某个时间之前已经完成的动作或状态。其结构是：had + been + 动词的过去分词。在这个例句中，moderated是动词moderate的过去分词，表示TSMC在2023年期间已经缓和了其资本支出计划。

  • The Hsinchu-based company reported a NT$625.5 billion quarter, matching earnings from the same period a year earlier
  • While it outdid analyst expectations and its own guidance, TSMC’s US$20.2 billion quarter still fell short of delivering growth

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC), the world's largest contract chip maker, saw its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline, as demand from artificial intelligence (AI) players helped offset sluggish smartphone and laptop chip sales.

Hsinchu-based TSMC, the main chip supplier to Apple and Nvidia, reported December sales of NT$176.3 billion (US$5.7 billion), completing a NT$625.5 billion quarter.

That matched earnings from the same period a year earlier, which was among TSMC’s highest quarterly results. The average analyst estimate for sales over the last three months was NT$616.2 billion.

Over the course of 2023, TSMC moderated its capital expenditure plans as the consumer electronics industry grappled with a glut of unsold inventory. The chip maker signalled the trough in demand had been reached in the summer and recovery would begin to take hold in the months leading up to 2024.

Overall revenue declined 4.5 per cent last year, to NT$2.16 trillion.

While it outdid analyst expectations and its own guidance, TSMC’s US$20.2 billion quarter still fell short of delivering growth. December sales were down 8.4 per cent on the same month a year earlier, offering a mixed outlook for the year ahead.

Top management including chief executive CC Wei have said they expect overall business to grow this year, and the company has seen its high-performance computing business boosted by demand for AI chips from Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices.

Earlier in the week, fellow chip maker Samsung Electronics posted its sixth successive quarter of declining operating profit, as it weathered the impact of muted consumer demand in its smartphone and memory businesses.

Still, the latest report from the Semiconductor Industry Association showed the first growth in chip sales in over a year came in November, suggesting momentum is gathering for a resurgence in 2024.

China to persist with AI development in 2024 despite US chip curbs: UBS

Upgrades to AI server farms and on-device AI applications are likely to drive an information technology replacement cycle, according to HSBC analysts Ricky Seo and Hankil Chang.

“For US cloud service providers, we expect capex to grow significantly, about 65 per cent in 2024e. Additionally, AI server purchases will likely total 57 per cent of their investments in 2024e, up from 8 per cent in 2022,” they wrote in a research note on Wednesday.

Apple, arguably TSMC’s most important customer, has faced headwinds with its latest iPhone generation in China, the world’s biggest smartphone market. Several analysts have downgraded Apple this year on expectations of soft demand, and this week Jefferies said the iPhone sales slump in China is likely to deepen.

The US company has also been hit by an expanded ban by Chinese agencies and state-owned companies ordering staff to keep iPhones and other foreign devices away from work premises.

item.title: Amazon’s Twitch to cut 500 employees, or 35% of staff, as soon as January 10 as business remains unprofitable
item.description:
English Summary：

  • Popular live-streaming site Twitch is cutting 35% of its staff (about 500 workers) due to losses and the departure of multiple top executives.
  • The company is struggling to stay profitable, despite attracting 1.8 billion hours of live video content per month and relying on Amazon's infrastructure for support.
  • Twitch's shift towards advertising has not been enough to offset its expenses, and it has continued to experience losses.
  • Newly appointed CEO Dan Clancy has been working on improving relations with video game streamers, who are the backbone of Twitch's content.
  • Despite his efforts, Clancy has struggled to stem the losses, leading to the latest round of layoffs.

Chinese Summary：

  • 备受欢迎的直播网站 Twitch 正在削减 35% 的员工（约 500 名员工），原因是公司亏损以及多位高管离职。
  • 尽管每月吸引 18 亿小时的直播视频内容并依赖亚马逊的基础设施获得支持，但该公司仍在努力保持盈利。
  • Twitch 向广告的转变不足以抵消其支出，且公司继续遭受亏损。
  • 新任首席执行官丹·克兰西一直在努力改善与游戏主播的关系，他们是 Twitch 内容的支柱。
  • 尽管他做出了努力，但克兰西仍难以阻止亏损，导致了最新一轮的裁员。

Words：

  • rely on (v.) - /rɪˈlaɪ ɒn/ 依靠，依赖。

    原文例句：Running a large-scale website supporting 1.8 billion hours of live video content a month is enormously expensive, despite Twitch’s reliance on Amazon’s infrastructure, company executives have said.

    例句讲解：rely on 的意思是“依赖，依靠”，可以与介词 on 搭配使用，表示“依靠，依赖”。在这个例句中，rely on 表示 Twitch 依赖亚马逊的基础设施来支持其网站的运行。

  • offset (v.) - /ˈɔːfˌset/ 抵消，补偿。

    原文例句：Twitch’s shift towards advertising has not been enough to offset its expenses, and it has continued to experience losses.

    例句讲解：offset 的意思是“抵消，补偿”，可以与介词 to 搭配使用，表示“抵消，补偿”。在这个例句中，offset 表示 Twitch 向广告的转变并不能抵消其支出。

Phrases：

  • shift towards - 转向，朝着…的方向发展。

    原文例句：Twitch’s shift towards advertising has not been enough to offset its expenses, and it has continued to experience losses.

    例句讲解：shift towards 表示“转向，朝着…的方向发展”，可以与介词 to 搭配使用，表示“转向，朝着…的方向发展”。在这个例句中，shift towards advertising 表示 Twitch 向广告的转变。

  • stem the losses - 阻止亏损。

    原文例句：The new chief has struggled to stem the losses, however.

    例句讲解：stem the losses 的意思是“阻止亏损”，表示采取措施来阻止亏损的继续发生。在这个例句中，stem the losses 表示阻止亏损。

Sentences：

  • In the final months of 2023, several top executives announced their departures, including Twitch’s chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer.

    句子分析：这是一个简单句，主语是several top executives，谓语是announced their departures，宾语是chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer。句子结构是主-谓-宾。In the final months of 2023 是一个介词短语，修饰谓语announced their departures，表示在 2023 年的最后几个月。including Twitch’s chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer 是一个分词短语，修饰宾语chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer，表示包括 Twitch 的首席产品官、首席客户官和首席内容官。这个句子的意思是，在 2023 年的最后几个月，包括 Twitch 的首席产品官、首席客户官和首席内容官在内的多位高管宣布离职。

Grammar：

  • 介词短语作状语 - 用于修饰动词或形容词，表示时间、地点、方式、原因等。

    原文例句：In the final months of 2023, several top executives announced their departures, including Twitch’s chief product officer.

    语法讲解：介词短语In the final months of 2023作状语，修饰谓语announced their departures，表示在 2023 年的最后几个月。

  • 分词短语作定语 - 用于修饰名词或代词，表示原因、目的、条件等。

    原文例句：including Twitch’s chief product officer

    语法讲解：分词短语including Twitch’s chief product officer作定语，修饰名词several top executives，表示包括 Twitch 的首席产品官。

  • The cuts come after Twitch’s chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer left in the final months of 2023
  • Running a large-scale website supporting 1.8 billion hours of live video content a month is enormously expensive, company executives have said

Amazon.com’s live-streaming site Twitch is poised to cut 35 per cent of its staff, or about 500 workers, according to people familiar with the plans, the latest in a series of job reductions there.

The cuts, which could be announced as soon as Wednesday, come amid concerns over losses at Twitch and after several top executives left the company in the span of a few months. A Twitch representative declined to comment.

Running a large-scale website supporting 1.8 billion hours of live video content a month is enormously expensive, despite Twitch’s reliance on Amazon’s infrastructure, company executives have said.

In December, Twitch chief executive Dan Clancy said the company would cease operations in South Korea, where the costs are “prohibitively expensive”, according to a blog post he wrote.

Twitch has increased its focus on advertising in recent years. Nine years after Amazon’s acquisition of the company, the business remains unprofitable, according to the people, who asked not to be identified discussing private information.

In the final months of 2023, several top executives announced their departures, including Twitch’s chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer. Twitch also lost its chief revenue officer, who worked on Twitch from within Amazon’s ads unit.

“It’s always bittersweet when talented leaders move on to pursue new opportunities,’’ a Twitch spokesman said at the time. “We are incredibly grateful for their contributions to Twitch and our community, and wish them all the best.”

The former employees all declined to comment.

Since he took the position in March 2023, Clancy has been on a cross-country charm offensive to mend relations with the video gaming celebrities who make a living streaming on Twitch.

Many of them chafed at Twitch’s original approach to ads, which the company reworked after criticism. Streamers have praised Clancy’s desire to listen to their concerns after years of complaints that the service was out of touch with its users.

The new chief has struggled to stem losses, however. Twitch undertook two rounds of lay-offs last year, cutting over 400 positions, part of wider job reductions at Amazon.

The online retail giant initiated its biggest-ever corporate job cuts in 2022, which it expanded to 27,000 positions across the company. It continued in October with a new round of cuts to its music division, which encompasses the company’s audio streaming platform and digital storefront for songs.

item.title: US SEC says its X account was compromised to falsely say bitcoin ETFs approved
item.description:
English summary：

  • The SEC's social media account was hacked and a fake post about the approval of spot bitcoin ETFs was posted, causing a surge in the price of Bitcoin.
  • The SEC is investigating the incident and has clarified that no decision on spot bitcoin ETFs has been made yet.
  • The agency has received applications from a dozen companies seeking to list bitcoin-backed ETFs in the US and is expected to make a decision soon.
  • The approval of spot bitcoin ETFs would mark a significant milestone for the cryptocurrency industry, but the SEC has raised concerns about investor protection and market manipulation in the past.

中文摘要：

  • 美国证券交易委员会（SEC）的社交媒体账号被黑客入侵，发布了一篇关于批准现货比特币ETF的虚假帖子，导致比特币价格飙升。
  • SEC正在调查这起事件，并澄清尚未就现货比特币ETF做出任何决定。
  • 该机构已收到十几家公司申请在美国上市比特币支持的ETF，预计将很快做出决定。
  • 现货比特币ETF的获批将成为加密货币行业的一个重要里程碑，但SEC过去曾对投资者保护和市场操纵提出担忧。

单词：

  • enforcement (n.) - /ɪnˈfɔːsmənt/ - 实施，执行。

    原文例句：In statements late on Tuesday, the regulator said that it would work with law enforcement to investigate the incident, the unauthorised access had been terminated, and that the post was not made by the SEC or its staff.

    例句讲解：这个单词由en-（ 使……成为）和force（力量）组成，表示“实施，执行”。在这个例句中，它指的是美国证券交易委员会将与执法部门合作调查该事件，未经授权的访问已终止，并且该帖子不是由美国证券交易委员会或其工作人员发布的。

  • vulnerability (n.) - /ˌvʌlnərəˈbɪləti/ - 弱点，脆弱性。

    原文例句：The irony of a cybersecurity incident befalling a regulator that has repeatedly warned of crypto’s online vulnerabilities was not lost on critics who have spent years waiting for the SEC to approve a bitcoin ETF.

    例句讲解：这个单词由vulnerable（脆弱的）和-ity（状态）组成，表示“弱点，脆弱性”。在这个例句中，它指的是在网络安全事件中，监管机构反复警告加密货币的在线弱点，这一讽刺并没有被那些多年来一直等待美国证券交易委员会批准比特币ETF的批评者所忽视。

  • speculation (n.) - /ˌspekjʊˈleɪʃən/ - 投机，猜测。

    原文例句：Traders have been speculating for weeks that the agency could approve several of the products as soon as Wednesday.

    例句讲解：这个单词由speculate（投机，猜测）和-tion（行为，过程）组成，表示“投机，猜测”。在这个例句中，它指的是，交易员们猜测美国证券交易委员会最早可能在周三批准其中的一些产品。

词组：

  • take action (v.) - 采取行动，采取措施。

    原文例句：The SEC has until January 10 to take action on at least one of those applications, and crypto insiders have speculated the regulator will use that date to announce a slew of decisions at once.

    例句讲解：这个词组由take（采取）和action（行动）组成，表示“采取行动，采取措施”。在这个例句中，它指的是，美国证券交易委员会必须在1月10日前至少对其中一项申请采取行动，加密货币内部人士猜测监管机构将利用这一日期一次性宣布多项决定。

句子：

  • The SEC’s X account was compromised and a fake post claiming that the agency had greenlit plans for the products fuelled a brief surge in the price of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency. - 美国证券交易委员会的X账户被黑客入侵，一篇声称该机构已批准这些产品的虚假帖子引发了全球最大加密货币价格的短暂上涨。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是The SEC’s X account was compromised，其中主语是The SEC’s X account，谓语是was compromised。a fake post claiming that the agency had greenlit plans for the products fuelled a brief surge in the price of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency是一个现在分词短语作状语，修饰主句，表示美国证券交易委员会的X账户被黑客入侵，一篇声称该机构已批准这些产品的虚假帖子引发了全球最大加密货币价格的短暂上涨。这个句子的意思是说，美国证券交易委员会的X账户被黑客入侵，一篇声称该机构已批准这些产品的虚假帖子引发了全球最大加密货币价格的短暂上涨。

语法：

  • 动词不定式作目的语 - 表示动作或状态的名称

    原文例句：The SEC said that there was unapproved activity on the @SECGov X account “by an unknown party for a brief period of time shortly after 4pm ET” on Tuesday.

    语法讲解：不定式是由动词原形加to组成的非谓语动词形式，不定式可以作句子成分，包括主语、宾语、表语、定语和状语。不定式作目的语时，表示动作或状态的名称。在这个例句中，不定式作目的语，表示未知人在周二下午4点东部时间后不久对@SECGov X账户进行了未经授权的活动。

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：In statements late on Tuesday, the regulator said that it would work with law enforcement to investigate the incident, the unauthorised access had been terminated, and that the post was not made by the SEC or its staff.

    语法讲解：现在完成时是由have/has been/were been+过去分词构成的时态，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示监管机构发表声明称，将与执法部门合作调查该事件，未经授权的访问已被终止，该帖子不是由美国证券交易委员会或其工作人员发布的。

  • US authorities are investigating how the @SECGov’s account was compromised by ‘an unknown party’
  • The regulator has clarified that no decision on spot bitcoin ETFs had been made

A highly anticipated decision by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on whether to approve a spot-bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) quickly morphed into a major cybersecurity incident on Tuesday.

The SEC’s X account was compromised and a fake post claiming that the agency had greenlit plans for the products fuelled a brief surge in the price of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency. It also has sparked an investigation by US authorities into how a social media account at Wall Street’s main regulator was compromised.

“It really shows the breadth and frequency of cyberattacks,” said Kurt Gottschall, a partner at law firm Haynes Boone and former SEC regional director. “The irony here is that the SEC has not shown much sympathy to public companies and asset managers that have experienced cybersecurity incidents.”

The breach gave fodder to crypto faithful who have long viewed the commission’s chairman, Gary Gensler, as an enemy due to his zeal to rein in the industry.

The irony of a cybersecurity incident befalling a regulator that has repeatedly warned of crypto’s online vulnerabilities was not lost on critics who have spent years waiting for the SEC to approve a bitcoin ETF. Traders have been speculating for weeks that the agency could approve several of the products as soon as Wednesday.

In statements late on Tuesday, the regulator said that it would work with law enforcement to investigate the incident, the unauthorised access had been terminated, and that the post was not made by the SEC or its staff. In a separate statement, Gensler clarified that no decision on ETFs had been made.

The SEC said that there was unapproved activity on the @SECGov X account “by an unknown party for a brief period of time shortly after 4pm ET” on Tuesday. After the fake post was removed, Joe Benarroch, head of business operations at X, said in a statement that the “account is secure and we are investigating the root cause”.

About a dozen companies have applied to list ETFs backed by bitcoin in the US. The SEC has until January 10 to take action on at least one of those applications, and crypto insiders have speculated the regulator will use that date to announce a slew of decisions at once.

There are two technical requirements that must be fulfilled before a spot-backed bitcoin ETF can start trading. First, the SEC must sign off on so-called 19b-4 filings by the exchanges that would list the ETFs. Second, the regulator must approve the relevant S-1 forms, which are the registration applications from the would-be issuers – a list that includes BlackRock and Fidelity.

The SEC is planning to vote on the exchanges’ filings, the 19b-4s, this week, Bloomberg News has reported. The regulator may or may not take action on the issuers’ applications, the S-1s, around the same time. If the SEC grants both sets of required approvals, the ETFs could start trading as soon as the next business day.

The SEC under Gensler and his Trump-era predecessor, Jay Clayton, has previously refused to allow such a product to launch, citing concerns about investor protection and the potential for market manipulation. However, speculation has been mounting since August, when the SEC lost a key legal fight against crypto asset manager Grayscale Investments, that the regulator will have to acquiesce to the growing clamour for the product.

Hype about an approval has been rampant on social media. Bitcoin surged as much as 10 per cent on October 16 when a crypto news site incorrectly posted on X that BlackRock had been approved to list a spot ETF. About US$85 million of mostly bearish trading positions were liquidated during the surge, which quickly reversed.

item.title: China to persist with AI development in 2024 despite rigid US chip restrictions, UBS analysts say
item.description:
Summary：

  • Despite US sanctions, China aims to advance its AI capabilities, including large language models (LLMs) and generative AI systems.
  • China seeks to overcome challenges by utilizing domestic AI accelerator programs and optimizing computing resource usage.
  • Experts believe China's semiconductor industry has shown resilience despite restrictions, with progress in mature node segments and growth in specific applications.

总结：

  • 尽管受到美国制裁，中国仍致力于推进其人工智能能力，包括大型语言模型（LLM）和生成式人工智能（AI）系统。
  • 中国寻求通过利用国内人工智能加速器计划和优化计算资源的使用来克服挑战。
  • 专家认为，尽管受到限制，中国半导体行业表现出韧性，在成熟节点领域取得进展并实现特定应用的增长。

单词：

  • accelerator (n.) - /ˌæksɪləˈreɪtə/ 加速器。

    原文例句：China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources,

    例句讲解：accelerator是由accelerate（加速）加-or（使……）派生出来的，表示“使加速的东西，加速器”。因此，在这个例句中，accelerator指的是国内人工智能加速器计划。

  • semiconductor (n.) - /semɪkənˈdʌktə/ 半导体。

    原文例句：China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources,

    例句讲解：semiconductor是由semi-（半）和conductor（导体）构成的，表示“半导体，半导体材料”。在这个例句中，semiconductor指的是半导体行业。

词组：

  • make progress - 取得进展。

    原文例句：China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources,

    例句讲解：make progress是由make（使，造成）和progress（进步）构成的，表示“使进步，取得进展”。在这个例句中，make progress表示中国在国内人工智能加速器计划和优化计算资源的使用方面取得了进展。

句子：

  • China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources, - 中国应该“在这些限制中工作并尝试通过利用国内人工智能加速器计划和更经济地使用计算资源取得进展”。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是China is expected to make progress，其中主语是China，谓语是is expected to make progress，宾语是progress。work within those constraints and try by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources是一个现在分词短语作状语，修饰make progress，表示中国应该“在这些限制中工作并尝试通过利用国内人工智能加速器计划和更经济地使用计算资源取得进展”。

语法：

  • 现在分词短语作状语 - 表示动作或状态发生的时间、方式或原因。

    原文例句：China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources,

    语法讲解：现在分词短语作状语是由现在分词和一个或多个修饰语构成的，放在句中作状语，表示动作或状态发生的时间、方式或原因。在这个例句中，现在分词短语作状语是work within those constraints and try by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources，表示中国应该“在这些限制中工作并尝试通过利用国内人工智能加速器计划和更经济地使用计算资源取得进展”。

  • China is expected to ‘work within those constraints’ while making progress via AI accelerators and more economical use of computing resources
  • The country’s ability to overcome setbacks caused by US exports controls must not be underestimated, according to UBS’ Nicolas Gaudois

China will press ahead this year with development of large language models (LLMs) – the technology used to train ChatGPT and similar applications – and generative artificial intelligence (AI) systems, despite restrictions imposed by the United States on the mainland’s access to advanced semiconductors, according to analysts from Swiss investment bank UBS.

China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources, said Nicolas Gaudois, head of Asia-Pacific technology research at UBS, during a webinar hosted by the bank on Tuesday.

Gaudois said US export controls have blocked China’s access to Nvidia chips used for AI projects, but indicated that the mainland’s ability to overcome such setbacks must not be underestimated.

The views expressed by UBS analysts reflect how China’s semiconductor industry weathered last year’s escalation of Washington’s tech sanctions, which restricted exports of advanced chip-making equipment and cutting-edge semiconductors for AI projects.

The mainland’s tech sector appeared to have overcome the chokehold of US export controls last year, when Huawei Technologies made a surprise return to the 5G smartphone market with new handsets powered by a “breakthrough” advanced made-in-China processor.

It showed the lengths taken by the US-blacklisted company to build up its operations, following years of struggles on account of trade sanctions.

Apart from that breakthrough, UBS analysts asserted that China’s semiconductor sector has developed well in certain unsanctioned segments, showing strong market growth over the past few years.

“Restrictions from the US are very limited on mature nodes,” said Randy Abrams, head of Taiwan Research at UBS, in the same webinar on Tuesday. He pointed out that sales of these mature-node chips have not been restricted.

“We have seen China make more effort to invest in those areas,” Abrams said. “We will see steady market pickup in mature applications, such as camera image sensors, micro-controllers, analogue chips and discrete semiconductor devices for EVs.”

China’s semiconductor industry weathers tough year amid tighter US sanctions

“In semiconductor equipment, local suppliers have built up their market share from very low single-digits into the mid- to high-single-digits,” he said. “Their gains come from supplying China semiconductor manufacturers, as they’ve added mature node capacity.”

Abrams said domestic chip-making equipment suppliers saw their market share increase to about 20 per cent on the back of demand from Chinese chip fabrication facilities. “So if we leave out the very advanced nodes, there are actually a lot of [investment] opportunities,” he said.

Global demand for chips, he said, is expected to start picking up, as soon as inventory pressures ease and procurement at semiconductor foundries improves.

A slew of sanctions imposed by the US since 2019 has also forced companies across China’s vast tech supply chain to work closely together.

Internet search giant Baidu, which runs Ernie Bot and the Ernie LLM, ordered US$61 million worth of Huawei’s 910B Ascend AI chips – which the Chinese firm developed as an alternative to Nvidia’s A100 processor – for 200 servers, according to a report in November by Reuters, which cited sources.

item.title: Alibaba’s DingTalk updates workplace collaboration app with new AI agent amid growing client demand
item.description:
Summary：

阿里巴巴旗下的钉钉加入AI智能助手功能帮助用户简化和定制工作流程。新功能旨在解决钉钉从70万企业客户处收集的反馈，有望推动行业对AI产品的更大采用。钉钉的目标是成为一个准入门槛较低AI智能助手平台，预估市场在未来三年中会显著增长。
  • Abstract: 钉钉推出AI智能助手功能，简化工作流程，推动AI产品采用。
  • Theme: 阿里巴巴的钉钉增加AI智能助手功能以提高工作效率。
  • Viewpoint: AI智能助手的作用和未来发展前景。
  • Main information: 钉钉的AI智能助手功能旨在解决客户反馈，推动AI产品采用，成为低准入门槛的AI智能助手平台，市场预计将显著增长。

English summary：

• Alibaba Group Holding's DingTalk app has launched an updated version featuring an AI agent function to help users simplify and customize their workflow. • The AI agent is powered by Alibaba's Tongyi Qianwen large language model, similar to chatbots like OpenAI's ChatGPT. • DingTalk aims to become a low-entry barrier AI agent platform, with the market expected to grow substantially in the next three years.
  • Abstract: Alibaba's DingTalk introduces AI agent function to enhance productivity.
  • Theme: DingTalk enhances workplace collaboration with AI integration.
  • Viewpoint: The role of AI in improving productivity and user experience.
  • Main information: DingTalk's AI agent is designed to address customer feedback, promote AI adoption, and become a leading AI agent platform.

单词：

  • streamline (v.) - /ˈstriːmˌlaɪn/ 简化，使精简。

    原文例句：The AI agent feature was announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由stream（河流）和line（线）构成的，表示“使流畅，使顺畅，使简化精简”。在这个例句中，它表示钉钉应用程序宣布在杭州举行的一次公司活动中推出了人工智能代理功能。

  • customise (v.) - /ˈkʌstəmaɪz/ 定制，自定义。

    原文例句：The AI agent function is designed to address feedback gleaned from more than 700,000 corporate clients, said Ye Jun, president of DingTalk, in a statement.

    例句讲解：这个单词由custom（习惯）和-ise（使……）组成，表示“使符合要求，使定制，使自定义”。在这个例句中，它表示钉钉的人工智能代理功能旨在解决来自超过 700,000 家企业客户的反馈。

词组：

  • corporate event - 公司活动，企业活动。

    原文例句：The AI agent feature was announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou.

    例句讲解：这个词组由corporate（公司的，企业的）和event（事件，活动）构成，表示“公司活动，企业活动”。在这个例句中，它表示钉钉的人工智能代理功能宣布在杭州举行的一次公司活动中推出。

  • large language model (LLM) - 大型语言模型。

    原文例句：DingTalk’s addition of an AI agent function, powered by the group’s Tongyi Qianwen large language model (LLM), comes after ByteDance’s Feishu made a similar push last November.

    例句讲解：这个词组由large（大的）和language model（语言模型）构成，表示“大型语言模型”。在这个例句中，它表示钉钉的人工智能代理功能的添加是由该集团的统一阡文大型语言模型提供支持的，而字节跳动的飞书在去年 11 月也做出了类似的努力。

句子：

  • Ye added that DingTalk’s goal is to become an AI agent platform with low entry barriers, with the marketplace expected to grow substantially in the next three years. - 叶表示，钉钉的目标是成为一个准入门槛较低的AI智能助手平台，预计市场在未来三年中会显著增长。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是DingTalk’s goal is to become an AI agent platform with low entry barriers，其中主语是DingTalk’s goal，谓语是to become，宾语是an AI agent platform。with the marketplace expected to grow substantially in the next three years是一个现在分词短语作状语，表示钉钉的目标实现的前提或条件，即预计市场在未来三年中会显著增长。这个句子的意思是说，叶补充说，钉钉的目标是成为一个准入门槛较低的AI智能助手平台，预计市场将在未来三年内大幅增长。

语法：

  • 过去将来时 - 表示对过去发生的事件或动作的预测或预期。

    原文例句：Ye Jun, president of DingTalk, said in a statement that the new tool is expected to promote greater adoption of AI products in the industry.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：would/should/could have + 过去分词。其中would/should/could可以根据语境选择，have要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，过去分词是动词的-ed形式。这种时态表示对过去发生的事件或动作的预测或预期，强调主语过去本可以或应该如何如何，但现在看来并没有实现。在这个例句中，它表示叶军在声明中表示，这个新工具有望促进业界对人工智能产品的更大采用。

  • 虚拟语气 - 表示与事实相反的假设或愿望。

    原文例句：They can help users with daily tasks such as drafting emails, drawing up spreadsheets and summarising long reports.

    语法讲解：这是一个语气，表示与事实相反的假设或愿望，结构是：虚拟语气助词（would/should/could/may/might）+ 动词原形。虚拟语气助词要根据语境选择，动词原形表示行为或状态。这种语气常用于表示建议、请求、许可、命令、愿望、假设等。在这个例句中，它表示人工智能助手可以帮助用户执行日常任务，例如起草电子邮件、编制电子表格和总结冗长报告。

  • DingTalk’s AI agent function is powered by Alibaba’sTongyi Qianwen large language model
  • The AI agent feature was announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou

Alibaba Group Holding’s DingTalk launched an updated version of its workplace collaboration app on Tuesday with the addition of an artificial intelligence (AI) agent function to help users streamline and customise their workflow.

The development comes amid a flurry of activity in the AI sector as Chinese companies rush to incorporate ChatGPT-like services into their products and after a similar move by ByteDance’s rival app Feishu. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

The AI agent feature announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou, capital of eastern Zhejiang province, is designed to address feedback gleaned from more than 700,000 corporate clients, said Ye Jun, president of DingTalk, in a statement.

The new tool is expected to promote greater adoption of AI products in the industry, according to the company.

“As the tide of AI-generated content increasingly finds its way into productivity and [business] use cases, AI agents have emerged as the most suitable gateway for AI applications,” said Ye.

ByteDance brings AI to office tool Feishu, taking on Tencent and Alibaba

Ye added that DingTalk’s goal is to become an AI agent platform with low entry barriers, with the marketplace expected to grow substantially in the next three years.

As of the end of 2023, Dingtalk had over 700 million users. It also has 25 million organisations, including corporate and educational institutions that use its platform, of which 120,000 are paying clients, said Ye.

Shoes and apparel giant Belle International has rolled out a customised AI agent on its DingTalk platform to track parcel shipment issues, with plans to expand the use of the agent to more cases, including stock allocation.

DingTalk’s addition of an AI agent function, powered by the group’s Tongyi Qianwen large language model (LLM), comes after ByteDance’s Feishu made a similar push last November.

LLMs are the deep learning models, pre-trained on vast amounts of data, that underpin chatbots such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT, which took the world by storm a year ago with its ability to understand complex questions and respond with human-like text.

At the launch of Feishu 7, ByteDance introduced an AI bot dubbed Feishu Intelligent Buddy, which can help users with daily tasks such as drafting emails, drawing up spreadsheets and summarising long reports.

Feishu also announced a platform to enable its corporate clients to build and customise AI bots according to business needs, it said at the time.

After a year of hype over AI chatbots, Chinese Big Tech firms including Alibaba, ByteDance and Baidu have been rushing to build competitor products to ChatGPT, with applications spanning the finance, legal, manufacturing, retail and public sectors.

item.title: Alibaba’s logistics arm Cainiao offers shoppers in US grouped delivery service, cutting shipping times to five days
item.description:
Summary：

Chinese logistics giant Cainiao is launching a new consolidated shipping service for Chinese consumers in the US, enabling them to combine several orders from different Chinese e-commerce platforms into a single package, significantly reducing delivery times and costs. This move comes ahead of Cainiao's planned $1 billion listing in Hong Kong.
  • Abstract: Cainiao's new cross-border shipping service streamlines online shopping for Chinese consumers in the US.
  • Theme: Cainiao's expansion into the US market with its consolidated shipping service, targeting Chinese consumers and students.
  • Viewpoint: The growing demand for efficient and cost-effective cross-border shipping services among Chinese consumers overseas.
  • Main information: Service details, including air and sea transport options, reduced delivery times, and potentially lower costs; Cainiao's prior experience in consolidated shipping; its upcoming Hong Kong listing; the company's role in Alibaba's e-commerce empire.

总结：

中国物流巨头菜鸟正为美国华裔消费者推出全新的合并发货服务，该服务可将用户在不同中国电商平台上所下的多个订单合并成为一个包裹，从而大幅缩短运输时间和降低成本。此举是在菜鸟计划在香港进行10亿美元上市之前进行的。
  • 摘要：菜鸟全新的跨境运输服务简化了美国华裔消费者的网购流程。
  • 主题：菜鸟携其合并发货服务进军美国市场，目标受众为华裔消费者与留学生。
  • 观点：海外华裔消费者对高效且划算的跨境运输服务日益增长的需求。
  • 主要信息：服务详情，包括空运及海运选择、缩短的运输时间和更低的潜在成本；菜鸟此前在合并发货领域的经验；其即将到来的香港上市计划；该公司在阿里巴巴电商帝国中的作用。

单词：

  • consolidate (v.) - /ˈkɑːnsəlɪdeɪt/ 巩固，合并。

    原文例句：The so-called “consolidated shipping” service, covering both air and sea transport routes, will collect multiple online shopping orders placed by users on various platforms in a warehouse before shipping them from China.

    例句讲解：“Consolidate”意为“巩固，合并”，在句中指将不同用户在多个平台上下的订单集中到一个仓库，再从中国发货，以此来简化运输流程，节省时间和成本。

  • streamline (v.) - /ˈstriːmlaɪn/ 简化，优化。

    原文例句：Chinese logistics giant Cainiao is launching a new consolidated shipping service for Chinese consumers in the US, enabling them to combine several orders from different Chinese e-commerce platforms into a single package, significantly reducing delivery times and costs.

    例句讲解：“Streamline”意为“简化，优化”，在句中指将多个订单合并成一个包裹，从而简化运输流程，缩短交货时间并降低成本。

词组：

  • cross-border shipping - 跨境运输，指货物或物品从一个国家运输到另一个国家。

    原文例句：Cainiao said cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers in US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese sites.

    例句讲解：“Cross-border shipping”意为“跨境运输”，在句中指的是菜鸟推出的跨境运输服务，旨在帮助在美国的中国消费者从中国电商网站上购买商品并运送到美国。

  • e-commerce empire - 电商帝国，指一家或多家电子商务公司构成的庞大商业网络，通常涉及多种产品或服务。

    原文例句：Established in 2013, Cainiao serves as the logistics backbone of Alibaba’s e-commerce empire, handling more than 4 million cross-border parcels on a daily basis in 2023.

    例句讲解：“E-commerce empire”意为“电商帝国”，在句中指的是阿里巴巴的电商帝国，即阿里巴巴及其旗下电商平台构成的庞大商业网络。

句子：

  • If the parcel is sent via air, delivery times may be reduced five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse. - 如果包裹通过空运发送，则交货时间可能会在包裹从仓库发出后缩短五天。

    句子分析：这是一个条件句，主句是delivery times may be reduced，条件状语从句是If the parcel is sent via air，其中If是条件连接词，the parcel is sent via air是条件，delivery times may be reduced是结果。five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse是一个时间状语，表示交货时间可能会在包裹从仓库发出后缩短五天。这个句子的意思是说，如果包裹通过空运发送，则交货时间可能会在包裹从仓库发出后缩短五天。

语法：

  • 名词性从句 - 由 that/whether/if/who 等引导，起名词作用的从句。

    原文例句：Cainiao said cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers in US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese sites.

    语法讲解：这是一个名词性从句，由 who 引导，起定语的作用，修饰 Chinese consumers，表示在美国的中国消费者。

  • 现在完成时态 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态，或表示过去的某个动作或状态一直延续到现在仍在继续。

    原文例句：Cainiao, Alibaba Group Holding’s logistics unit, will open a new service for consumers in the US to allow them to package several items they have bought together, cutting delivery times to as little as five days.

    语法讲解：这是一个现在完成时态，由have/has和过去分词构成，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。在这个例句中，have bought表示消费者已经购买了多件商品，cutting delivery times表示将交货时间缩短到五天。这个句子的意思是说，菜鸟将为美国消费者开通一项新服务，让他们可以将多件商品打包在一起，从而将交货时间缩短到五天。

  • Cainiao said cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers in US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese sites
  • The so-called ‘consolidated shipping’ service covers both air and sea transport routes

Cainiao, Alibaba Group Holding’s logistics unit, will open a new service for consumers in the US to allow them to package several items they have bought together, cutting delivery times to as little as five days.

Cainiao said in a statement on Tuesday that the cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers and students in the US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese e-commerce sites. As of 2020, there were roughly 60 million Chinese living outside the country, according to a report by Huaqiao University.

If the parcel is sent via air, delivery times may be reduced five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse. If by sea, the new service may cut the cost to as low as 12 yuan (US$1.7), depending on the size of the parcel, according to the statement.

The new overseas service comes ahead of Cainiao’s planned US$1 billion listing in Hong Kong. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

Alibaba’s AliExpress, PDD-owned Temu face supply chain challenges in South Korea

The so-called “consolidated shipping” service, covering both air and sea transport routes, will collect multiple online shopping orders placed by users on various platforms in a warehouse before shipping them from China.

Prior to its US expansion, Cainiao provided consolidated shipping to shoppers in other markets outside mainland China, including Hong Kong, Singapore and Australia.

In November, Cainiao and Alibaba were part of a consortium that made a US$57 million offer to buy Chinese logistics company Best. Best is a major courier in China and has a presence in Southeast Asia. In the third quarter of 2023, Best’s global businesses achieved revenue of US$37.7 million, contributing to 12.4 per cent of the total.

Cainiao has its eye on the overseas market, and recorded more than 1.5 billion cross-border e-commerce parcel deliveries in its recent financial year to March, making it one of the world’s top logistics services providers, according to its prospectus.

Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion, subject to market conditions, according to a Post report in September that cited people familiar with the situation. The listing is part of a group-wide restructuring of Alibaba, as the e-commerce titan seeks to free up decision- making amid increased competition.

Established in 2013, Cainiao serves as the logistics backbone of Alibaba’s e-commerce empire, handling more than 4 million cross-border parcels on a daily basis in 2023. Alibaba announced it would spin off Cainiao in the restructuring announced in March.

item.title: CES 2024: China TV makers Hisense and TCL promote AI, live sports at US show
item.description:
Summary：

In a battle of global stature and AI processing capabilities, two prominent Chinese TV brands, Hisense and TCL, unveiled their latest lineups at CES 2024. They emphasized their ability to produce technology in-house and their expansion into areas like AR. Hisense displayed its flagship 110-inch ULED X television and project-based laser TVs, while TCL presented the world's largest mini-LED TV at 115 inches. Both brands highlighted the use of mini LEDs for enhanced image quality and a wide range of contrast.
  • Abstract: Chinese TV giants Hisense and TCL showcase their latest innovations in AI processing and display technology at CES 2024.
  • Theme: Competition between Hisense and TCL to establish dominance in the global TV market through advanced technology and supply chain capabilities.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of AI integration, mini LED technology, and the expansion into new areas like AR in the future of TV and home entertainment.
  • Main information: Hisense's ULED X television with AI chipsets; TCL's largest mini-LED TV and its AIPQ processors; both brands' ventures into AR and VR technology.

总结：

在全球地位和人工智能处理能力的竞争中，两大中国电视品牌海信和TCL在2024年CES上公布了他们的最新产品阵容。他们强调了他们能够在内部生产技术的能力，以及他们如何向增强现实等领域拓展。海信展示了他们的旗舰产品110英寸ULED X电视和基于投影的激光电视，而TCL则展示了世界上最大的115英寸Mini LED电视。这两个品牌都强调了Mini LED的使用，以便提高图像质量和宽范围对比度。
  • 摘要：中国电视巨头海信和TCL在2024年CES上展示了他们在人工智能处理和显示技术方面的最新创新。
  • 主题：海信和TCL通过先进技术和供应链能力，在全球电视市场确立主导地位的竞争。
  • 观点：人工智能集成、Mini LED技术以及向增强现实等新领域的拓展在未来电视和家庭娱乐中的重要性。
  • 主要信息：海信带有人工智能芯片组的ULED X电视；TCL最大的Mini LED电视和它的AIPQ处理器；这两个品牌的增强现实和虚拟现实技术的冒险。

单词：

  • emphasis (n.) - /ˈɛmfəsɪs/ 强调，重点，意义。

    原文例句：Hisense USA president David Gold said the company’s ability to produce displays and even its own AI chipsets without third parties is something that sets it apart.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于希腊语emphasis，意思是“重要性，力量”。在这个例句中，它指的是强调或突出显示某个事物或概念的重要性或意义。

  • narrative (n.) - /ˈnærətɪv/ 叙述，故事，描述。

    原文例句：Both companies offered competing narratives, presenting themselves as the biggest Chinese brands in the US television space.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语narrare，意思是“讲述，叙述”。在这个例句中，它指的是一个故事、描述或叙述，特别是用来表达一个观点或解释某个事件或情况。

词组：

  • fall to something - 依赖于某物，依靠某物。

    原文例句：The focus on live television has largely fallen to sports, a major reason households remain subscribed to cable and satellite TV packages.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由fall（跌落，下降）和to（向……）构成的，表示“依靠，依赖”。在这个例句中，它表示直播电视的焦点主要依赖于体育运动，这是家庭仍然订阅有线和卫星电视套餐的一个主要原因。

  • out of something - 没有，缺乏，用尽。

    原文例句：Stefan Streit, chief marketing officer of TCL Communication, introduces the RayNeo X2 Lite smart glasses at CES 2024 in Las Vegas, January 8, 2024. Photo: Bloomberg

    例句讲解：这个词组是由out（离开，在外）和of（属于，关于）构成的，表示“没有，缺乏，用尽”。在这个例句中，它表示没有，缺乏，用尽。

句子：

  • Hisense US president David Gold said the company’s ability to produce displays and even its own AI chipsets without third parties is something that sets it apart. - 海信美国公司总裁戴维·戈德表示，该公司能够在没有第三方的情况下生产显示器，甚至生产自己的AI芯片组，这是其区别于其他公司的特点。

  • It is also offering a new Rollable Laser TV, which is exactly what it sounds like: a projector screen that rolls up and disappears, offering a cleaner look at home when not in use. - 它还提供了一种新型的可卷曲激光电视，它就像它的名字一样：一个可以卷起来并消失的投影仪屏幕，在不使用时提供更干净的家庭外观。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是It is also offering a new Rollable Laser TV，其中主语是It，谓语是is offering a new Rollable Laser TV。which is exactly what it sounds like是一个非限制性定语从句，解释说明It is also offering a new Rollable Laser TV，表示它就像它的名字一样。a projector screen that rolls up and disappears, offering a cleaner look at home when not in use是一个现在分词短语作定语，修饰projector screen，表示一个可以卷起来并消失的投影仪屏幕，在不使用时提供更干净的家庭外观。这个句子的意思是说，它还提供了一种新型的可卷曲激光电视，它就像它的名字一样：一个可以卷起来并消失的投影仪屏幕，在不使用时提供更干净的家庭外观。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：TCL announced what it said is the world’s largest mini-LED TV at 115 inches.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示TCL宣布它所说的世界上最大的mini-LED电视是115英寸。

  • 不定式短语作定语 - 表示不定式短语对中心语的修饰。

    原文例句：The focus on live television has largely fallen to sports, a major reason households remain subscribed to cable and satellite TV packages.

    语法讲解：这是一个不定式短语作定语，结构是：不定式+中心语。其中不定式可以是现在不定式、过去不定式或完成不定式。不定式短语作定语放在中心语之前，表示对中心语的修饰。在这个例句中，它表示直播电视的焦点主要依赖于体育运动，这是家庭仍然订阅有线和卫星电视套餐的一个主要原因。

  • The two biggest Chinese TV brands offered competing narratives about their global stature and AI processing capabilities
  • The companies emphasised their ability to produce much of their technology in-house and how they are branching out into areas like AR

Chinese television set makers Hisense and TCL unveiled their latest line-ups at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Monday, with an emphasis on artificial intelligence (AI) and making screens the centre of the home, while pushing into new areas like cars.

Both companies offered competing narratives, presenting themselves as the biggest Chinese brands in the US television space. They also boasted about their supply chain prowess and the ability to manufacture leading technologies in-house.

David Gold, president of Hisense USA, said the company’s ability to produce displays and even its own AI chipsets without third parties is something that sets it apart.

“When you think about global players, I think we are one of less than a handful of companies that have everything that it takes to be able to truly provide a smart home solution,” Gold said after the Hisense presentation. “We have all the ingredients, all the components. There are very few companies out there that can do the same.”

Tech giants Alibaba, ByteDance lead China’s return to CES

The flagship product from Hisense this year is its new 110-inch ULED X television with a brightness of 10,000 nits and 40,000 backlight zones.

Not to be outdone, TCL announced what it said is the world’s largest mini-LED TV at 115 inches. TCL referred to itself as a “great global power” with 32 research and development centres and 43 manufacturing sites around the world.

Mini LEDs featured prominently in the presentations of both Hisense and TCL, as they each presented their brands as the best option for finding this tech in TVs that cost just a few hundred dollars, rather than thousands.

Hisense said that mini LEDs – which cram more LEDs into a display to offer a greater range of contrast and image quality – are now integrated into all its models, including one for under US$500.

Hisense also introduced its new so-called laser TVs, which are projectors combined with an ambient-light-rejecting screen. The company said its newest 8K Sonic Laser TV is the “world’s largest sound-emitting screen”, offering a sound bar-like experience built into the projector. It is also offering a new Rollable Laser TV, which is exactly what it sounds like: a projector screen that rolls up and disappears, offering a cleaner look at home when not in use.

Both companies used sports to draw attention to their new TVs. As more viewers switch to streaming, the focus on live television has largely fallen to sports, a major reason households remain subscribed to cable and satellite TV packages.

TCL leaned into this heavily, inviting sportscasters including Charissa Thompson and former National Football League player Charles Woodson on stage for nearly the entire duration of the presentation.

Hisense highlighted the ability of its AI chips to enhance picture quality by identifying whether the video is coming from streaming, cable or another source.

“[Our AI is] about recognising what content it is, the quality, the factor in which it’s being displayed – whether it’s streaming, cable, DVDs, Blu-ray – and finding the way to enhance that picture quality,” Gold said. “Usually you put in one setting and never change it again. What we’re trying to do with AI is automatically detect, ‘Oh, now you’re watching football, let’s move to a sport setting’.”

Seemingly omnipresent at CES 2024, AI was mentioned repeatedly during both presentations, as it has been by rivals like Samsung and LG.

TCL talked of enhancing access to its AI processing with three levels of its AIPQ processors, which include “pro” and “ultra” versions. The AI processors are now offered in its cheaper S Class series.

While TVs are typically the highlight for these events from the Chinese display giants, they are also chasing other trends in the industry. TCL mentioned the latest version of the RayNeo X2 smart glasses, which can display images on the lenses to do things like offer real-time text translation. TCL incubated RayNeo.

The company also highlighted its newest smartphones and tablets with an emphasis on its Nxtpaper display, which is meant to be easier on the eyes like e-reader displays.

Hisense is working on its own augmented reality (AR) glasses and a virtual reality headset, but both are just prototypes for now.

It has also followed many of its Chinese peers – like Xiaomi and Huawei Technologies – into the auto sector. It is working on bringing its projector technology into cars to, among other things, turn the windscreen into an AR display. The company said this enhances safety because drivers do not need to take their eyes off the road when getting information like navigation.

“If you’re on the road and your smart refrigerator can tell you, ‘hey, you’re out of eggs; so on your way home, stop by and pick up some eggs,’ that’s the idea that we’re going for,” Gold said.

Many tech firms are betting on cars as the next big area of growth. As leaders in electric vehicles, Chinese companies are benefiting from the trend. Carmakers Li Auto, Great Wall Motor, Zeekr and Xiaomi will all use Nvidia’s Drive tech for autonomous driving, the chip firm announced on Monday.

Samsung and Sony also discussed their own partnerships with carmakers in their presentations on Monday. Sony has partnered with Honda on its Afeela joint venture, while Samsung is partnering with Hyundai to bring its SmartThings platform to cars.

  • A routine internal audit at Dada found US$140 million worth of questionable revenue and costs in the firm’s books for the first three quarters of 2023
  • Shanghai-based Dada has reported the potential case of fraud to police, according to local media

An on-demand delivery firm affiliated with Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com lost 46 per cent of its stock value in New York on Monday, following an inquiry into “suspicious” data during an internal audit, dealing a fresh blow to confidence in China’s tech stocks.

Dada Nexus, which operates JD Daojia and Dada Now, found 1 billion yuan (US$140 million) worth of questionable revenue and costs in its books for the first three quarters of 2023 during a routine internal audit, according to its corporate filing. Parent JD.com’s share price tumbled 3 per cent on Tuesday in Hong Kong.

Nasdaq-listed Dada said an estimated 500 million yuan of online advertising and marketing service revenue plus another 500 million yuan of operations and support costs for the first three quarters of 2023 may have been overstated.

While the amount that is subject of the inquiry makes up just about a third of Dada’s total revenue in the September quarter, a potential fraud in the company’s books could further undermine investor confidence in Chinese internet stocks.

The investigation at Dada comes nearly a month since the company’s chairman, Xin Lijun, stepped down from his post “for personal reasons” effective on December 19. In that same corporate announcement of management changes at Dada, Chen Zhaoming resigned as the firm’s chief financial officer.

Shanghai-based Dada, according to a report by Chinese news outlet The Paper, has reported the potential fraud case to local police.

A JD.com representative referred the South China Morning Post to Dada’s US filing and declined to provide further details. Dada did not immediately respond to a request for comment on Tuesday.

Dada had earlier said it was working with third-party agencies, including an accounting company and a law firm, to conduct an independent review of the case.

In separate filings with regulators, both JD.com and Dada said they are committed to maintaining high corporate-governance standards and internal controls.

Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com wins antitrust lawsuit against Alibaba

Founded in Shanghai in 2014, Dada runs two core businesses: parent JD.com’s on-demand retail platform JD Daojia and its own Dada Now. Both these operations work with bricks-and-mortar retailers and merchants on fulfilment, including delivery of online orders to consumers in under roughly an hour.

JD Daojia operates in more than 1,700 counties, districts and cities across mainland China, while Dada Now does business in 2,700 domestic locations.

In November, Dada reported that total third-quarter revenue rose 20.4 per cent year on year to 2.9 billion yuan.

On-demand delivery is a hotly contested field on the mainland, where Dada competes against the likes of food delivery giant Meituan and JD.com rival Alibaba Group Holding, which owns the Post.

item.title: ByteDance confirms talks with Tencent, other potential buyers over sale of video game operations
item.description:
English Summary：

ByteDance, the owner of TikTok and Douyin, is in talks to sell its video game operations, including its gaming studio Nuverse, to Tencent, the world's largest gaming company by revenue. ByteDance has struggled to make profits from its gaming investments despite spending heavily on game development and acquisitions. The company is looking to restructure its gaming business and focus on long-term strategic growth areas.
  • Abstract: ByteDance explores sale of video game operations to Tencent.
  • Theme: ByteDance's challenges in monetizing its gaming investments and its decision to restructure its gaming business.
  • Viewpoint: The impact of ByteDance's gaming investments on its overall business; the importance of focusing on long-term strategic growth areas.
  • Main information: ByteDance's negotiations with Tencent; the company's decision to shut down most unreleased game projects and sell rights to some titles; restructuring of the gaming business.

  • long-term strategic growth areas - 长期的战略增长领域。

    原文例句：ByteDance representative said at the time that it decided to “restructure its gaming business” and “make adjustments to focus on long-term strategic growth areas”.

    例句讲解：这个词组由long-term（长期的），strategic（战略的），growth（增长）和areas（领域）组成，表示“长期的战略增长领域”。在这个例句中，它指的是字节跳动代表当时表示，决定“重组其游戏业务”，并“做出调整，专注于长期的战略增长领域”。

句子：

  • ByteDance has failed to achieve returns from its video gaming investments. - 字节跳动未能从其视频游戏投资中获得回报。

    句子分析：这是一个简单的复合句，主句是ByteDance has failed，其中主语是ByteDance，谓语是has failed，宾语是to achieve returns。从句是from its video gaming investments，其中介词短语from its video gaming investments作状语，表示字节跳动未能从其视频游戏投资中获得回报。这个句子的意思是说，字节跳动未能从其视频游戏投资中获得回报。

    句子分析：这是一个简单的复合句，主句是ByteDance founder Zhang Yiming was never a video gaming enthusiast，其中主语是ByteDance founder Zhang Yiming，谓语是was never，宾语是a video gaming enthusiast。从句是before dipping his toe in the market，其中介词短语before dipping his toe in the market作状语，表示在涉足游戏市场之前。这个句子的意思是说，字节跳动创始人张一鸣，2021年辞去董事长兼首席执行官，在涉足游戏市场之前，他从来不是一个游戏爱好者。

    原文例句：ByteDance has failed to achieve returns from its video gaming investments. - 字节跳动未能从其视频游戏投资中获得回报。

    语法讲解：这是一个现在完成时态的动词短语，结构是：has/have + 过去分词。其中has/have要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，过去分词是动词的-ed形式或不规则动词的过去分词形式。现在完成时态表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。在这个例句中，它表示字节跳动从过去的某个时间开始一直到现在未能从其视频游戏投资中获得回报。

  • 介词短语 - 起修饰语作用。

    原文例句：ByteDance founder Zhang Yiming, who stepped down as chairman and CEO in 2021, was never a video gaming enthusiast before dipping his toe in the market. - 字节跳动创始人张一鸣，2021年辞去董事长兼首席执行官，在涉足游戏市场之前，他从来不是一个游戏爱好者。

    语法讲解：介词短语是一个由介词和名词或代词组成的结构，在句中起修饰语的作用。介词短语可以用来修饰动词、形容词、副词或其他介词短语。在这个例句中，介词短语in 2021作状语，修饰动词stepped down，表示张一鸣在2021年辞去董事长兼首席执行官。介词短语before dipping his toe in the market作状语，修饰谓语部分was never，表示在涉足游戏市场之前。

    TikTok owner ByteDance has confirmed that it is in talks with multiple potential buyers for its video game operations, including Tencent Holdings, the world’s biggest gaming company by revenue.

    The confirmation from a ByteDance representative on Tuesday came after local media outlet LatePost reported that the company's gaming unit Nuverse was in negotiations with Tencent regarding the disposal of its operations. According to the report, ByteDance was lowering the valuation of its video gaming studios to try and make a deal after spending more than 100 million yuan (US$14 million) developing various titles.

    The representative said that the company has not reached an agreement with Tencent.

    In November, the South China Morning Post reported that the Beijing-based company told employees that it would shut down most game projects that had not been released online, and sell rights to at least two of its titles – the anime-style role-playing game Crystal of Atlan and sci-fi survival game Earth: Revival.

    ByteDance also started lay-offs at its games unit, which employs nearly 2,000 people, although the exact number of affected employees was not clear. Some workers who want to remain at ByteDance could be allowed to transfer to other teams, the Post reported.

    A ByteDance representative said at the time that it decided to “restructure its gaming business” and “make adjustments to focus on long-term strategic growth areas”.

    Despite its huge success with short video app TikTok and its Chinese version Douyin, ByteDance has failed to achieve returns from its video gaming investments. The company spent around 30 billion yuan on video game acquisitions and investments involving more than 20 studios between 2019 and 2022, according to local media outlet DingjiaoOne.

    “While the company made US$54 billion in the first half of 2023, less than 1 per cent of that came from their video games business,” said Lisa Hanson, chief executive of gaming industry consultancy Niko Partners.

    ByteDance founder Zhang Yiming, who stepped down as chairman and CEO in 2021, was never a video gaming enthusiast before dipping his toe in the market.

    Yan Shou, head of ByteDance’s video gaming unit, spent most of his career in strategic investments and hired several people with a consulting and strategy background to help him run the unit, the Post reported.

    Zhang had grown impatient with the slow development, complaining in 2022 about the lack of progress at the gaming division during a video call with executives, saying that its Moonton studio had not grown despite doubling its headcount, tech media outlet The Information reported in December. Reuters reported a month earlier that ByteDance was in talks to sell Moonton.
